content: {name= 'John'; age= '18'; country= 'Turkey'; curvisa= 'No'; time_to_get_to_US= '1 year'; reason='university'}

Based on your background as an 18-year-old from Turkey planning to study at a university in the U.S. within the next year and currently not holding a visa, I recommend applying for an F-1 student visa.

The F-1 visa is specifically designed for individuals like you who wish to pursue academic studies in the United States at an accredited institution. To apply for an F-1 visa, you will first need to be accepted by a Student and Exchange Visitor Program (SEVP)-approved school. Once accepted, you can proceed with the visa application process, which may include an interview at the U.S. embassy or consulate in Turkey.

Make sure to have all the necessary documentation ready, including your I-20 form issued by the school, proof of financial support, and intent to return to Turkey after completing your studies. Additionally, demonstrating ties to your home country, such as family, property, or job prospects, can strengthen your visa application.

Overall, the F-1 student visa would be the most suitable option for you to pursue your university studies in the United States. Good luck with your academic journey!
